column2: Whole grain bread, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Red pepper flakes, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil
column4: 2. Mash avocado and spread it evenly on the toast.
column5: 3. Sprinkle with salt pepper and red pepper flakes to taste.
column6: 4. Optionally top with sliced cherry tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.

column2: Greek yogurt, Granola, Mixed berries (such as strawberries, blueberries, raspberries), Honey
column3: 1. In a bowl or glass layer Greek yogurt granola and mixed berries.
column4: 2. Repeat layers until the container is filled.
column5: 3. Drizzle honey on top if desired.

column2: Oats, Bananas, Apples, Cinnamon, Maple syrup
column3: 1. Cook oats according to package instructions.
column4: 2. Once cooked top with sliced bananas diced apples and a sprinkle of cinnamon.
column5: 3. Optionally add a drizzle of maple syrup for sweetness.

column2: Frozen mixed berries, Banana, Spinach, Greek yogurt, Almond milk, Granola, Honey
column3: 1. In a blender combine frozen mixed berries banana spinach Greek yogurt and almond milk.
column5: 3. Pour into a bowl and top with sliced banana granola and a drizzle of honey.

column2: Eggs, Bell peppers, Onion, Spinach, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Cheese (optional)
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced bell peppers onions and spinach to the skillet.
column6: 4. Crack eggs into the skillet and scramble until cooked through.
column7: 5. Season with salt pepper and a sprinkle of cheese if desired.

column2: Salmon fillets, Mixed vegetables (such as zucchini, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, asparagus), Olive oil, Lemon juice, Garlic, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as dill, thyme)
column4: 2. Toss mixed vegetables with olive oil lemon juice minced garlic salt pepper and fresh herbs.
column5: 3. Arrange seasoned vegetables on a baking sheet and roast in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until tender.
column6: 4. Season salmon fillets with salt and pepper and place on the baking sheet with the vegetables.
column7: 5. Return the baking sheet to the oven and roast for an additional 10-12 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through.

column2: Quinoa, Chickpeas, Mixed vegetables (such as cucumber, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, red onion), Lemon juice, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh herbs (such as parsley, cilantro)
column3: 1. Cook quinoa according to package instructions and let it cool.
column4: 2. In a large bowl combine cooked quinoa drained and rinsed chickpeas mixed vegetables and chopped fresh herbs.
column5: 3. Drizzle with lemon juice and olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
column6: 4. Toss to combine and serve chilled.

column2: Whole grain bread, Smoked Salmon, Avocado, Salt, Pepper, Red pepper flakes, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil
column4: 2. Mash avocado and spread it evenly on the toast.
column5: 3. Use 2 forks to shred the smoked salmon and add it to the top of the avocado.
column6: 4. Sprinkle with salt pepper and red pepper flakes to taste
column7: 5. Optionally top with sliced cherry tomatoes and a drizzle of olive oil.

column2: Chickpeas, Spinach, Onion, Garlic, Curry powder, Coconut milk, Tomato sauce, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced onion and minced garlic and cook until softened.
column5: 3. Stir in curry powder and cook for another minute.
column6: 4. Add chickpeas coconut milk and tomato sauce and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
column7: 5. Stir in baby spinach until wilted.
column8: 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
column9: 7. Serve hot over cooked rice or quinoa.

column2: Pasta (gluten-free if desired), Cherry tomatoes, Cucumber, Bell peppers, Red onion, Black olives, Italian dressing, Fresh basil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Cook pasta according to package instructions then rinse with cold water and drain well.
column4: 2. Halve cherry tomatoes dice cucumber and bell peppers and thinly slice red onion.
column5: 3. In a large bowl combine cooked pasta cherry tomatoes cucumber bell peppers and black olives.
column6: 4. Drizzle with Italian dressing and toss to coat.
column7: 5. Garnish with fresh basil leaves and season with salt and pepper to taste.
column8: 6. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

column2: Portobello mushrooms, Quinoa, Onion, Garlic, Tomato, Spinach, Olive oil, Balsamic vinegar, Italian seasoning, Salt, Pepper
column4: 2. Remove the stems from portobello mushrooms and clean the caps.
column5: 3. In a skillet heat olive oil over medium heat and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.
column6: 4. Add diced tomato and chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until spinach wilts.
column7: 5. Stir in cooked quinoa and season with Italian seasoning salt and pepper.
column8: 6. Drizzle portobello mushroom caps with balsamic vinegar and olive oil and place them on a baking sheet.
column9: 7. Stuff each mushroom cap with the quinoa mixture.
column10: 8. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes or until mushrooms are tender.

column2: Chickpeas, Spinach, Onion, Garlic, Curry powder, Coconut milk, Tomato sauce, Olive oil, Salt, Pepper
column3: 1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat.
column4: 2. Add diced onion and minced garlic and cook until softened.
column5: 3. Stir in curry powder and cook for another minute.
column6: 4. Add chickpeas coconut milk and tomato sauce and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
column7: 5. Stir in baby spinach until wilted.
column8: 6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
column9: 7. Serve hot over cooked rice or quinoa.

column2: Arborio rice, Vegetable broth, Mushrooms (such as cremini or shiitake), Onion, Garlic, White wine (optional), Parmesan cheese (optional), Butter (optional), Olive oil, Salt, Pepper, Fresh parsley
column3: 1. In a saucepan heat vegetable broth and keep it warm over low heat.
column4: 2. In a separate large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat.
column5: 3. Add diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet
column7: 4. Add sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until browned and tender.
column8: 5. Stir in Arborio rice and cook for 1-2 minutes until lightly toasted.
column9: 6. If using add white wine to the skillet and stir until absorbed.
column10: 7. Begin adding warm vegetable broth to the skillet 1 cup at a time stirring frequently and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding more.
column11: 8. Continue adding broth and stirring until the rice is creamy and tender about 20-25 minutes.
column12: 9. If desired stir in grated Parmesan cheese and butter for added creaminess.
column13: 10. Season with salt and pepper to taste and garnish with chopped fresh parsley before serving.

column1: Shrimp and Vegetable Skewers with Quinoa Pilaf
column2: Shrimp, Bell peppers, Red onion, Cherry tomatoes, Olive oil, Lemon juice, Garlic powder, Italian seasoning, Salt, Pepper, Quinoa, Vegetable broth, Green peas
column3: 1. Soak wooden skewers in water for 30 minutes.
column4: 2. Thread shrimp bell peppers red onion and cherry tomatoes onto skewers.
column5: 3. In a small bowl whisk together olive oil lemon juice garlic powder Italian seasoning salt and pepper.
column6: 4. Brush skewers with the olive oil mixture.
column7: 5. Grill skewers over medium-high heat for 3-4 minutes per side or until shrimp are pink and vegetables are tender.
column8: 6. Meanwhile cook quinoa in vegetable broth according to package instructions.
column9: 7. Stir in green peas and let sit for 5 minutes.
column10: 8. Serve shrimp and vegetable skewers with quinoa pilaf.

column1: Baked Salmon with Quinoa and Asparagus
column2: Salmon fillets, Quinoa, Asparagus, Lemon, Olive oil, Garlic, Salt, Pepper, Fresh dill
column4: 2. Season salmon fillets with salt pepper minced garlic and fresh dill.
column5: 3. Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
column6: 4. Toss asparagus spears with olive oil lemon juice salt and pepper.
column7: 5. Arrange asparagus around the salmon on the baking sheet.
column8: 6. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes or until salmon is cooked through and asparagus is tender.
column9: 7. Serve salmon and asparagus over cooked quinoa.
